title: Bering Land Bridge National Preserve: Plants
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Plants               Plants         A small piece of tundra is home to dozens of plant species NPS Photo - Andrea Willingham  Examine just a small section of tundra, and you will find it is covered with dozens of species of grasses, wildflowers, berries, mosses, and lichens. In summer, over 300 species of vascular plants fill the air with sweet fragrance and display every color imaginable. The trees and shrubs change to rich oranges, reds, and yellows during the fall season. To learn more about the common wild flora you'll find at Bering Land Bridge, check out the links to the left.
